ratings.question_text: Overall, how would you rate the workload of this course in comparison to other Yale courses you have taken?
What is your overall assessment of this course?
Do you expect to use this class for credit toward your major, or toward a pre-professional program?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize ECON 110 05 for a fellow student? Would you recommend ECON 110 05 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: This course is wonderful. It is a lot of work, but I would definitely take it again. It is one of the best classes I've taken at Yale.

A nice overview of the history of dance. It is primarily ballet/modern dance-focused (since that's Prof. Coates's training), but you do get a bit of tap, African dance, and tango thrown in as well. The class can feel like a lot of work, since there's ~75-100 pages of reading and ~1 hour of viewing per week, plus reading responses due before each class, but the readings and viewings are all really interesting. Prof. Coates is such a phenomenal dancer, and the times when she performs a bit of dance or talks about her past dance career are really inspirational.

I'm a graduating senior, and I am so glad I got to take this class before I leave Yale, as it's simply one of the best I've taken here. It has opened me up to such a wealth of dance (way beyond my previously ballet-limited knowledge) from across the past century in America and further afield, and is far more than just a history of dance - it takes in so many more fields and areas of interest. Professor Coates is one of the best people working at Yale, with an incredibly dance career and knowledge, and a genuine love of bringing this to her students. TAKE IT NOW.

If you're looking for a fun, informational class about the history of dance this is the right class. There is a (short) movement exercise each week so if you're looking for something that will get you on your feet often, perhaps look elsewhere. The exercises are fun but they are just a small portion of the class. The discussions are very informational and Coates facilitates well so everyone can get a chance to speak. The papers and projects are fun because they are on a topic to your liking, Coates will help you with the fine details. Overall, pretty good class; easy, fun, and changes the way you look at dance.
